rev.diff:
Line 43: Line 43:
==Criticisms==
==Criticisms==
â
There had been some criticism regarding the delay between the official release of an application, and the availability of a portable version. Also, fewer applications are available than supported by some other platforms, though, unlike [[U3]] and [[Ceedo]], anyone can easily add any portable software to the PortableApps.com Menu.
+
There had been some criticism regarding the delay between the official release of an application, and the availability of a portable version. Also, fewer applications are available than supported by some other platforms, though, unlike [[U3]] and [[Ceedo]], anyone can easily add any portable software to the PortableApps.com Menu.{{fact}}
There is a bug in Firefox Portable which may leave files behind when associating a file from the internet with another program. This can be avoided by closing the associated file before closing Firefox{{Fact|date=June 2008}}<!--if bug still there, this comment should at least be dated-->.
There is a bug in Firefox Portable which may leave files behind when associating a file from the internet with another program. This can be avoided by closing the associated file before closing Firefox{{Fact|date=June 2008}}<!--if bug still there, this comment should at least be dated-->.
â
Even if autorun is enabled on the host PC, the PortableApps menu cannot run automatically unless set up to do so on first install under Windows XP or Vista. Instead the user has to be prompted if they want to see it or not. [[U3]] uses a hardware component to let a memory stick imitate a CD drive, allowing the autorun feature to display a menu upon insertion.
+
Even if autorun is enabled on the host PC, the PortableApps menu cannot run automatically unless set up to do so on first install under Windows XP or Vista. Instead the user has to be prompted if they want to see it or not. [[U3]] uses a hardware component to let a memory stick imitate a CD drive, allowing the autorun feature to display a menu upon insertion.{{fact}}
â
A number of the applications included in PortableApps.com are inherently portable, with ''official'' versions of the software being released (for example) in [[ZIP (file format)|ZIP]] format, which can simply be uncompressed and copied to a USB drive, where it would be ready for use anyway. The repackaging of these applications only serves to integrate with the PortableApps.com menu.
+
A number of the applications included in PortableApps.com are inherently portable, with ''official'' versions of the software being released (for example) in [[ZIP (file format)|ZIP]] format, which can simply be uncompressed and copied to a USB drive, where it would be ready for use anyway. The repackaging of these applications only serves to integrate with the PortableApps.com menu.{{fact}}
